result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clay Edward Rich

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clay Edward Rich in court, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court for Clay Edward Rich.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Parties are requesting an adjournment, negotiations are continuing. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Clay Edward Rich not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court for Clay Edward Rich.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Clay E. Rich, Washington County Jail, 500 Rolfs Ave, West Bend WI 53090).

Defendant Clay Edward Rich appeared by video, in custody in Washington County Jail.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Clay Edward Rich.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Rainey. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with All Menards locations; Michael W.B. DOB 02/25/1970; Tracey M.J. DOB 12/05/1967; Micah N. DOB 10/03/1988

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

Defendant Clay Edward Rich appeared by video, in custody at Washington County Jail.  Attorney Jaymes Fenton appeared by viedo for Clay Edward Rich,  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Clay Edward Rich not in court. Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 05/05/2022 at 1:30PM in OCCR.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 1:30p
